page.title: 04Tourism in Woburn 2
page.content: Visitors to Woburn come from many parts of the world.In 1985 visitors from W.Germany,Canada,U.S.A.,Sweden, Zambia,Norway and the Netherlands signed the Visitors Book in{St.Mary's {Church}(see Religion).The Church has an enormous organ and beautiful gardens.Cream teas are served on Sunday afternoons in July and August. There are also Concerts featuring Choirs and Bands in the Church.{The} {Heritage Centre}is housed in the old church tower of 1830 and the Mortuary Chapel built in 1865 when the old church was demolished.A voluntary trust was set up when the building became redundant in 1982.The church tower still houses one remaining bell and the original mechanism of the clock made by Benjamin Louis Vulliamy, clockmaker to William 1V,for John 6th Duke in 1830.
